get.summary: Get a filtered list of List

parameters.name: dateCreatedRangeStart
parameters.description: Define the beginning for an interval of time and only include Lists that are created within this interval.

parameters.name: dateCreatedRangeEnd
parameters.description: Define the end for an interval of time and only include Lists that are created within this interval.

parameters.name: dateModifiedRangeStart
parameters.description: Define the beginning for an interval of time and only include Lists that are modified within this interval.

parameters.name: dateModifiedRangeEnd
parameters.description: Define the end for an interval of time and only include Lists that are modified within this interval.

parameters.name: listDbId
parameters.description: An array of primary database identifiers to identify a set of Lists

parameters.name: listName
parameters.description: An array of human readable names to identify a set of Lists

parameters.name: listOwnerName
parameters.description: An array of names for the people or entities who are responsible for a set of Lists

parameters.name: listOwnerPersonDbId
parameters.description: An array of primary database identifiers to identify people or entities who are responsible for a set of Lists

parameters.name: listSource
parameters.description: An array of terms identifying lists from different sources (ie 'USER', 'SYSTEM', etc)

get.summary: Get a filtered list of Location

parameters.name: commonCropName
parameters.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

parameters.name: locationDbId
parameters.description: The location ids to search for

parameters.name: locationName
parameters.description: A human readable names to search for

parameters.name: programDbId
parameters.description:
A BrAPI Program represents the high level organization or group who is responsible for conducting trials and studies. Things like Breeding Programs and Funded Projects are considered BrAPI Programs. 

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given programs. 

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

parameters.name: programName
parameters.description:
Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given program names. Program names are not required to be unique.

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

parameters.name: abbreviation
parameters.description: A list of shortened human readable names for a set of Locations

parameters.name: altitudeMin
parameters.description: The minimum altitude to search for

parameters.name: altitudeMax
parameters.description: The maximum altitude to search for

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: [ISO_3166-1_alpha-3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3) spec

parameters.name: countryName
parameters.description: The full name of the country to search for

parameters.name: instituteAddress
parameters.description: The street address of the institute to search for

parameters.name: instituteName
parameters.description: The name of the institute to search for

parameters.name: locationType
parameters.description: The type of location this represents (ex. Breeding Location, Storage Location, etc)

parameters.name: parentLocationDbId
parameters.description:
The unique identifier for a Location
The Parent Location defines the encompassing location that this location belongs to. For example, an Institution might have multiple Field Stations inside it and each Field Station might have multiple Fields.

parameters.name: parentLocationName
parameters.description:
A human readable name for a location
The Parent Location defines the encompassing location that this location belongs to. For example, an Institution might have multiple Field Stations inside it and each Field Station might have multiple Fields.

parameters.name: commonCropName
parameters.description:

parameters.name: programName

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: email address for this person

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Persons first name

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Persons last name

parameters.name: mailingAddress
parameters.description: physical address of this person

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Persons middle name

parameters.name: personDbId
parameters.description: Unique ID for this person

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: phone number of this person

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: A systems user ID associated with this person. Different from personDbId because you could have a person who is not a user of the system.

get.summary: Get a filtered list of Program

parameters.name: commonCropName
parameters.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

parameters.name: abbreviation
parameters.description: A list of shortened human readable names for a set of Programs

parameters.name: leadPersonDbId
parameters.description: The person DbIds of the program leader to search for

parameters.name: leadPersonName
parameters.description: The names of the program leader to search for

parameters.name: objectife
parameters.description: A program objective to search for

parameters.name: programType
parameters.description:
The type of program entity this object represents
'STANDARD' represents a standard, permanent breeding program
'PROJECT' represents a short term project, usually with a set time limit based on funding

get.summary: Get a filtered list of Season

parameters.name: seasonDbId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a season. For backward compatibility it can be a string like '2012', '1957-2004'.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: The term to describe a given season. Example "Spring" OR "May" OR "Planting_Time_7".

parameters.name: seasonName
parameters.description: The term to describe a given season. Example "Spring" OR "May" OR "Planting_Time_7".

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The 4 digit year of a season. Example "2017"

parameters.description: List of IDs which uniquely identify germplasm to search for

parameters.name: germplasmName
parameters.description: List of human readable names to identify germplasm to search for

parameters.description: The location ids to search for

parameters.name: locationName

parameters.name: studyDbId
parameters.description: List of study identifiers to search for

parameters.name: studyName
parameters.description: List of study names to filter search results

parameters.name: trialDbId
parameters.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a trial to search for

parameters.name: trialName
parameters.description: The human readable name of a trial to search for

parameters.name: observationVariableDbId
parameters.description: The DbIds of Variables to search for

parameters.name: observationVariableName
parameters.description: The names of Variables to search for

parameters.name: observationVariablePUI
parameters.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of an Observation Variable, usually in the form of a URI

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: A flag to indicate if a Study is currently active and ongoing

parameters.name: seasonDbId
parameters.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a season

parameters.name: studyType
parameters.description: The type of study being performed. ex. "Yield Trial", etc

parameters.name: studyCode
parameters.description: A short human readable code for a study

parameters.name: studyPUI
parameters.description: Permanent unique identifier associated with study data. For example, a URI or DOI

get.summary: Get a filtered list of Trial

parameters.name: commonCropName
parameters.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

parameters.name: locationDbId
parameters.description: The location ids to search for

parameters.name: locationName
parameters.description: A human readable names to search for

parameters.name: observationVariableDbId
parameters.description: The DbIds of Variables to search for

parameters.name: observationVariableName
parameters.description: The names of Variables to search for

parameters.name: observationVariablePUI
parameters.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of an Observation Variable, usually in the form of a URI

parameters.name: programDbId
parameters.description:
A BrAPI Program represents the high level organization or group who is responsible for conducting trials and studies. Things like Breeding Programs and Funded Projects are considered BrAPI Programs. 

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given programs. 

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

parameters.description:
Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given program names. Program names are not required to be unique.

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

parameters.name: studyDbId
parameters.description: List of study identifiers to search for

parameters.name: studyName
parameters.description: List of study names to filter search results

parameters.name: trialDbId
parameters.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a trial to search for

parameters.name: trialName
parameters.description: The human readable name of a trial to search for

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: A flag to indicate if a Trial is currently active and ongoing

parameters.name: contactDbId
parameters.description: List of contact entities associated with this trial

parameters.name: searchDateRangeStart
parameters.description:
The start of the overlapping search date range. `searchDateRangeStart` must be before `searchDateRangeEnd`.

Return a Trial entity if any of the following cases are true

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is null 

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate`

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is null

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate`

parameters.name: searchDateRangeEnd
parameters.description:
The end of the overlapping search date range. `searchDateRangeStart` must be before `searchDateRangeEnd`.

Return a Trial entity if any of the following cases are true

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is null 

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate`

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is null

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate`

parameters.name: trialPUI
parameters.description: A permanent identifier for a trial. Could be DOI or other URI formatted identifier.

post.description:
Submit a search request for `List`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/list/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

Submit a search request for `Location`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/location/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

Submit a search request for `Person`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/person/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

Submit a search request for `Program`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/program/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

Submit a search request for `Study`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/study/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

Submit a search request for `Trial`
Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use the corresponding `GET /search/trial/{searchResultsDbId}` to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

get.description:
Get the results of a `List` search request
Clients should submit a search request using the corresponding `POST /search/list` endpoint. Search requests allow a client to send a complex query for data. However, the server may not respond with the search results immediately. If a server needs more time to process the request, it might respond with a `searchResultsDbId`. Use this endpoint to retrieve the results of the search.
Review the Search Services documentation for additional implementation details.

additionalProperties.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object.

AdditionalInfo.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

attributeCategory.description: General category for the attribute. very similar to Trait class.

attributeDbId.description: The ID which uniquely identifies this attribute within the given database server

attributeDescription.description: A human readable description of this attribute

attributeName.description: A human readable name for this attribute

attributePUI.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of an Attribute, usually in the form of a URI

contextOfUse.description: Indication of how trait is routinely used. (examples: ["Trial evaluation", "Nursery evaluation"])

documentationURL.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

growthStage.description: Growth stage at which measurement is made (examples: "flowering")

institution.description: Name of institution submitting the variable

language.description: 2 letter ISO 639-1 code for the language of submission of the variable.

scientist.description: Name of scientist submitting the variable.

submissionTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the Variable was added (ISO 8601)

contactDbId.description:
The ID which uniquely identifies this contact

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-33) Person ID - An identifier for the data submitter. If that submitter is an individual, ORCID identifiers are recommended.

email.description:
The contacts email address

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-32) Person email - The electronic mail address of the person.

instituteName.description:
The name of the institution which this contact is part of

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-35) Person affiliation - The institution the person belongs to

name.description:
The full name of this contact person

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-31) Person name - The name of the person (either full name or as used in scientific publications)

orcid.description:
The Open Researcher and Contributor ID for this contact person (orcid.org)

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-33) Person ID - An identifier for the data submitter. If that submitter is an individual, ORCID identifiers are recommended.

type.description:
The type of person this contact represents (ex: Coordinator, Scientist, PI, etc.)

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-34) Person role - Type of contribution of the person to the investigation

Context.title: context
Context.description:
The JSON-LD Context is used to provide JSON-LD definitions to each field in a JSON object. By providing an array of context file urls, a BrAPI response object becomes JSON-LD compatible.  

For more information, see https://w3c.github.io/json-ld-syntax/#the-context

dataFormat.description:
The structure of the data within a file. For example - VCF, table, image archive, multispectral image archives in EDAM ontology (used in Galaxy)

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-38) Data file description - Description of the format of the data file. May be a standard file format name, or a description of organization of the data in a tabular file.

description.description:
The general description of this data link

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-38) Data file description - Description of the format of the data file. May be a standard file format name, or a description of organization of the data in a tabular file.

fileFormat.description:
The MIME type of the file (ie text/csv, application/excel, application/zip).

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-38) Data file description - Description of the format of the data file. May be a standard file format name, or a description of organization of the data in a tabular file.

name.description:
The name of the external data link

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-38) Data file description - Description of the format of the data file. May be a standard file format name, or a description of organization of the data in a tabular file.

provenance.description: The description of the origin or ownership of this linked data. Could be a formal reference to software, method, or workflow.

scientificType.description: The general type of data. For example- Genotyping, Phenotyping raw data, Phenotyping reduced data, Environmental, etc

url.description:
URL describing the location of this data file to view or download

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-37) Data file link - Link to the data file (or digital object) in a public database or in a persistent institutional repository; or identifier of the data file when submitted together with the MIAPPE submission.

version.description:
The version number for this data 

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-39) Data file version - The version of the dataset (the actual data).

DataLink.description: A link to extra data files associated with this study. Extra data could include notes, images, and reference data.

datasetPUI.description: The DOI or other permanent unique identifier for this published dataset

license.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-7) License - License for the reuse of the data associated with this investigation. The Creative Commons licenses cover most use cases and are recommended.

publicReleaseDate.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-6) Public release date - Date of first public release of the dataset presently being described.

submissionDate.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-5) Submission date - Date of submission of the dataset presently being described to a host repository.

DatasetAuthorships.description: License and citation information for the data in this trial

description.description: Human-readable value of the environment parameter (defined above) constant within the experiment

environmentParametersDbId.description: Human-readable value of the environment parameter (defined above) constant within the experiment

parameterName.description:
Name of the environment parameter constant within the experiment

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-58) Environment parameter - Name of the environment parameter constant within the experiment.

parameterPUI.description: URI pointing to an ontology class for the parameter

unit.description: Unit of the value for this parameter

unitPUI.description: URI pointing to an ontology class for the unit

value.description:
Numerical or categorical value

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-59) Environment parameter value - Value of the environment parameter (defined above) constant within the experiment.

valuePUI.description: URI pointing to an ontology class for the parameter value

EnvironmentParameter.description:
Environmental parameters that were kept constant throughout the study and did not change between observation units. 

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-57) Environment - Environmental parameters that were kept constant throughout the study and did not change between observation units or assays. Environment characteristics that vary over time, i.e. environmental variables, should be recorded as Observed Variables (see below).

PUI.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-23) Type of experimental design - Type of experimental  design of the study, in the form of an accession number from the Crop Ontology.

description.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-22) Description of the experimental design - Short description of the experimental design, possibly including statistical design. In specific cases, e.g. legacy datasets or data computed from several studies, the experimental design can be "unknown"/"NA", "aggregated/reduced data", or simply 'none'.

ExperimentalDesign.description: The experimental and statistical design full description plus a category PUI taken from crop research ontology or agronomy ontology

referenceId.description: The external reference ID. Could be a simple string or a URI.

referenceSource.description: An identifier for the source system or database of this reference

GeoJSON.description:
One geometry as defined by GeoJSON (RFC 7946). All coordinates are decimal values on the WGS84 geographic coordinate reference system.

Copied from RFC 7946 Section 3.1.1

A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

oneOf.description:
Copied from RFC 7946 Section 3.1.1

A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

An array of Linear Rings. Each Linear Ring is an array of Points. 

A Point is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

GeoJSONPoint.description:
Copied from RFC 7946 Section 3.1.1

A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

GeoJSONPolygon.description:
An array of Linear Rings. Each Linear Ring is an array of Points. 

A Point is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

PUI.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-27) Type of growth facility - Type of growth facility in which the study was carried out, in the form of an accession number from the Crop Ontology.

description.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-26) Description of growth facility - Short description of the facility in which the study was carried out.

GrowthFacility.description: Short description of the facility in which the study was carried out.

lastUpdateDbId.description: The date and time when this study was last modified

LastUpdate.description: The date and time when this study was last modified

listDbId.description: The unique identifier for a List

allOf.description: A List represents a collection of other BrAPI data objects. Typically these are custom lists generated by a user to keep track of interesting data. For example, a user might build a List of Germplasm that they have manually marked for further study.

data.description: The array of DbIds of the BrAPI objects contained in a List

dateCreated.description: Timestamp when the entity was first created

dateModified.description: Timestamp when the entity was last updated

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

listName.description: Human readable name of a List

listOwnerName.description: Human readable name of a List Owner. (usually a user or person)

listSize.description: The number of elements in a List

listSource.description: The description of where a List originated from

ListNewRequest.description: A List represents a collection of other BrAPI data objects. Typically these are custom lists generated by a user to keep track of interesting data. For example, a user might build a List of Germplasm that they have manually marked for further study.

dateCreatedRangeEnd.description: Define the end for an interval of time and only include Lists that are created within this interval.

dateCreatedRangeStart.description: Define the beginning for an interval of time and only include Lists that are created within this interval.

dateModifiedRangeEnd.description: Define the end for an interval of time and only include Lists that are modified within this interval.

dateModifiedRangeStart.description: Define the beginning for an interval of time and only include Lists that are modified within this interval.

listDbIds.description: An array of primary database identifiers to identify a set of Lists

listNames.description: An array of human readable names to identify a set of Lists

listOwnerNames.description: An array of names for the people or entities who are responsible for a set of Lists

listOwnerPersonDbIds.description: An array of primary database identifiers to identify people or entities who are responsible for a set of Lists

listSources.description: An array of terms identifying lists from different sources (ie 'USER', 'SYSTEM', etc)

ListSearchRequest.description: A List represents a collection of other BrAPI data objects. Typically these are custom lists generated by a user to keep track of interesting data. For example, a user might build a List of Germplasm that they have manually marked for further study.

ListType.description: The type of objects that are referenced in a List

locationDbId.description: The unique identifier for a Location

allOf.description: A geographic Location on earth. This is usually used to describe the general area where an experiment took place. For example, a natural site, an experimental field, a greenhouse, a phenotyping facility, etc.

abbreviation.description: A shortened version of the human readable name for a Location

coordinateDescription.description: Describes the precision and landmarks of the coordinate values used for a Location. (ex. the site, the nearest town, a 10 kilometers radius circle, +/- 20 meters, etc)

coordinateUncertainty.description: Uncertainty associated with the coordinates in meters. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown.

countryCode.description:
[ISO_3166-1_alpha-3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3) spec
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-17) Geographic location (country) - The country where the experiment took place, either as a full name or preferably as a 2-letter code.'

countryName.description:
The full name of the country where a Location is located
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-17) Geographic location (country) - The country where the experiment took place, either as a full name or preferably as a 2-letter code.

documentationURL.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

environmentType.description: Describes the general type of environment of a Location. (ex. forest, field, nursery, etc)

exposure.description: Describes the level of protection/exposure for things like sun light and wind at a particular Location

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

instituteAddress.description:
The street address of the institute at a particular Location
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-16) Contact institution - Name and address of the institution responsible for the study.

instituteName.description:
The full name of the institute at a particular Location
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-16) Contact institution - Name and address of the institution responsible for the study.

locationType.description: A short description of a type of Location (ex. Field Station, Breeding Location, Storage Location, etc)

siteStatus.description: Description of the accessibility of the location (ex. Public, Private)

slope.description: Describes the approximate slope (height/distance) of a Location.

topography.description: Describes the topography of the land at a Location. (ex. Plateau, Cirque, Hill, Valley, etc)

LocationNewRequest.description: A geographic Location on earth. This is usually used to describe the general area where an experiment took place. For example, a natural site, an experimental field, a greenhouse, a phenotyping facility, etc.

abbreviations.description: A list of shortened human readable names for a set of Locations

altitudeMax.description: The maximum altitude to search for

altitudeMin.description: The minimum altitude to search for

commonCropNames.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

countryNames.description: The full name of the country to search for

instituteAddresses.description: The street address of the institute to search for

instituteNames.description: The name of the institute to search for

locationDbIds.description: The location ids to search for

locationNames.description: A human readable names to search for

locationTypes.description: The type of location this represents (ex. Breeding Location, Storage Location, etc)

parentLocationDbIds.description:
The unique identifier for a Location
The Parent Location defines the encompassing location that this location belongs to. For example, an Institution might have multiple Field Stations inside it and each Field Station might have multiple Fields.

parentLocationNames.description:
A human readable name for a location
The Parent Location defines the encompassing location that this location belongs to. For example, an Institution might have multiple Field Stations inside it and each Field Station might have multiple Fields.

programDbIds.description:
A BrAPI Program represents the high level organization or group who is responsible for conducting trials and studies. Things like Breeding Programs and Funded Projects are considered BrAPI Programs. 

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given programs. 

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

programNames.description:
Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given program names. Program names are not required to be unique.

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

LocationSearchRequest.description: A geographic Location on earth. This is usually used to describe the general area where an experiment took place. For example, a natural site, an experimental field, a greenhouse, a phenotyping facility, etc.

levelName.description: A name for this level **Standard Level Names: study, field, entry, rep, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, plant, pot, sample** For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

levelOrder.description: `levelOrder` defines where that level exists in the hierarchy of levels. `levelOrder`'s lower numbers are at the top of the hierarchy (ie field -> 1) and higher numbers are at the bottom of the hierarchy (ie plant -> 9). For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

ObservationUnitHierarchyLevel.description: The exact level and level code of an observation unit. For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation. MIAPPE V1.1 DM-71 Observation unit type "Type of observation unit in textual form, usually one of the following: study, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, pot, plant. Use of other observation unit types is possible but not recommended. The observation unit type can not be used to indicate sub-plant levels. However, observations can still be made on the sub-plant level, as long as the details are indicated in the associated observed variable (see observed variables). Alternatively, it is possible to use samples for more detailed tracing of sub-plant units, attaching the observations to them instead."

term.description: Ontology term - the label of the ontology term the termId is pointing to.

termURI.description: Ontology term identifier - the CURIE for an ontology term. It differs from the standard GA4GH schema's :ref:`id ` in that it is a CURIE pointing to an information resource outside of the scope of the schema or its resource implementation.

OntologyTerm.description: A pointer to an ontology used by a genomic reference

allOf.description: A generic object used to maintain the metadata needed to describe a human. The Person might be a software user, a field technician, or a primary contact for a Program.

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

userID.description: A systems user ID associated with this person. Different from personDbId because you could have a person who is not a user of the system.

PersonNewRequest.description: A generic object used to maintain the metadata needed to describe a human. The Person might be a software user, a field technician, or a primary contact for a Program.

publicationPUI.description: The permanent unique identifier of the publication.

Publication.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-9) Associated publication - An identifier for a literature publication where the investigation is described. Use of DOIs is recommended.

seasonDbId.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a season. For backward compatibility it can be a string like '2012', '1957-2004'

seasonName.description: Name of the season. ex. 'Spring', 'Q2', 'Season A', etc.

year.description: The 4 digit year of the season.

Season.description: A Season defines a period in time. A Season is made of two parts; (1) the primary year and (2) a term which defines a segment of the year. This term could be a traditional season, like "Spring" or "Summer", or this term could be a month, like "May" or "June", or this could be an arbitrary season name which is meaningful to the breeding Program like "PlantingTime_3" or "Season E".

studyDbId.description:
The ID which uniquely identifies a study within the given database server

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-11) Study unique ID - Unique identifier comprising the name or identifier for the institution/database hosting the submission of the study data, and the identifier of the study in that institution.

allOf.description: A Study represents an experiment that has taken place at a single location. The Study contains metadata about the parameters and design of the experiment. It can also be used to group results and data sets generated from the experiment. A Trial can represent a collection of one or more Studies.

active.description: A flag to indicate if a Study is currently active and ongoing

commonCropName.description: Common name for the crop associated with this study

culturalPractices.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-28) Cultural practices - General description of the cultural practices of the study.

dataLinks.description: List of links to extra data files associated with this study. Extra data could include notes, images, and reference data.

documentationURL.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

endDate.description:
The date the study ends

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-15) End date of study - Date and, if relevant, time when the experiment ended

environmentParameters.description:
Environmental parameters that were kept constant throughout the study and did not change between observation units.

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-57) Environment - Environmental parameters that were kept constant throughout the study and did not change between observation units or assays. Environment characteristics that vary over time, i.e. environmental variables, should be recorded as Observed Variables (see below).

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

license.description: The usage license associated with the study data

observationLevels.description: Observation levels indicate the granularity level at which the measurements are taken. `levelName` defines the level, `levelOrder` defines where that level exists in the hierarchy of levels. `levelOrder`s lower numbers are at the top of the hierarchy (ie field > 0) and higher numbers are at the bottom of the hierarchy (ie plant > 6). **Standard Level Names: study, field, entry, rep, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, plant, pot, sample** For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

observationUnitsDescription.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-25) Observation unit description - General description of the observation units in the study.

seasons.description: List of seasons over which this study was performed.

startDate.description:
The date this study started

MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-14) Start date of study - Date and, if relevant, time when the experiment started

The description of this study

studyPUI.description: A permanent unique identifier associated with this study data. For example, a URI or DOI

studyType.description: The type of study being performed. ex. "Yield Trial", etc

It can also be used to group results and data sets generated from the experiment. A Trial can represent a collection of one or more Studies.

TraitDataType.description:
Class of the scale, entries can be

"Code" - This scale class is exceptionally used to express complex traits. Code is a nominal scale that combines the expressions of the different traits composing the complex trait. For example a severity trait might be expressed by a 2 digit and 2 character code. The first 2 digits are the percentage of the plant covered by a fungus and the 2 characters refer to the delay in development, e.g. "75VD" means "75 %" of the plant is infected and the plant is very delayed.

"Date" - The date class is for events expressed in a time format, See ISO 8601

"Duration" - The Duration class is for time elapsed between two events expressed in a time format, e.g. days, hours, months

"Nominal" - Categorical scale that can take one of a limited and fixed number of categories. There is no intrinsic ordering to the categories

"Numerical" - Numerical scales express the trait with real numbers. The numerical scale defines the unit e.g. centimeter, ton per hectare, branches

"Ordinal" - Ordinal scales are scales composed of ordered categories

"Text" - A free text is used to express the trait.

The ID which uniquely identifies a trial

contacts.description: List of contact entities associated with this trial

searchDateRangeEnd.description:
The end of the overlapping search date range. `searchDateRangeStart` must be before `searchDateRangeEnd`.

Return a Trial entity if any of the following cases are true

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is null 

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate`

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is null

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate`

searchDateRangeStart.description:
The start of the overlapping search date range. `searchDateRangeStart` must be before `searchDateRangeEnd`.

Return a Trial entity if any of the following cases are true

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is null 

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate`

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is null

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate`

studyNames.description: List of study names to filter search results

contextOfUse.description: Indication of how trait is routinely used. (examples: ["Trial evaluation", "Nursery evaluation"])

documentationURL.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

growthStage.description: Growth stage at which measurement is made (examples: "flowering")

institution.description: Name of institution submitting the variable

language.description: 2 letter ISO 639-1 code for the language of submission of the variable.

scientist.description: Name of scientist submitting the variable.

submissionTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the Variable was added (ISO 8601)

Variable.description: A unique combination of Trait, Method, and Scale to define a clear context for an Observation.

currentPage.description: The index number for the returned page of data. This should always match the requested page number or the default page (0).

pageSize.description: The number of data elements returned, aka the size of the current page. If the requested page does not have enough elements to fill a page at the requested page size, this field should indicate the actual number of elements returned.

totalCount.description: The total number of elements that are available on the server and match the requested query parameters.

totalPages.description:
The total number of pages of elements available on the server. This should be calculated with the following formula.
totalPages = CEILING( totalCount / requested_page_size)

basePagination.description:
The pagination object is applicable only when the payload contains a "data" key. It describes the pagination of the data contained in the "data" array, as a way to identify which subset of data is being returned.
Pages are zero indexed, so the first page will be page 0 (zero).

fileURL.description: The absolute URL where the file is located

fileSize.description: The size of the file in bytes

fileDescription.description: A human readable description of the file contents
fileDescription.example: This is an Excel data file

fileType.description: The type or format of the file. Preferably MIME Type.

fileMD5Hash.description: The MD5 Hash of the file contents to be used as a check sum

dataFile.description: A dataFile contains a URL and the relevant file metadata to represent a file

datafiles.description:
The datafiles contains a list of file URLs and metadata. 
These files contain additional information related to the returned object and can be retrieved by a subsequent call. 
This could be a supplementary data file, an informational file, the uploaded file where the data originated from, a generated file representing the whole dataset in a particular format, or any other related file.

status.description:
The status field contains a list of informational status messages from the server. 
If no status is reported, an empty list should be returned. See Error Reporting for more information.

metadataBase.description: An object in the BrAPI standard response model that describes some information about the service call being performed. This includes supplementary data, status log messages, and pagination information.

message.description: A short message concerning the status of this request/response

messageType.description: The logging level for the attached message

status.description: An array of status messages to convey technical logging information from the server to the client.

nextPageToken.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
The string token used to query the next page of data.

currentPageToken.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
The string token used to query the current page of data.

prevPageToken.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
The string token used to query the previous page of data.

allOf.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
The pagination object is applicable only when the payload contains a "data" key. It describes the pagination of the data contained in the "data" array, as a way to identify which subset of data is being returned.
Tokenized pages are for large data sets which can not be efficiently broken into indexed pages. Use the nextPageToken and prevPageToken to construct an additional query and move to the next or previous page respectively.

application/json.example: ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - Missing or expired authorization token
ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - User does not have permission to perform this action

ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - Malformed JSON Request Object

ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - Invalid query parameter

ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - Required parameter is missing
ERROR - 2018-10-08T18:15:11Z - The requested object DbId is not found

externalReferenceId.name: externalReferenceId
externalReferenceId.description: An external reference ID. Could be a simple string or a URI. (use with `externalReferenceSource` parameter)

externalReferenceSource.name: externalReferenceSource
externalReferenceSource.description: An identifier for the source system or database of an external reference (use with `externalReferenceId` parameter)

acceptHeader.name: Accept
acceptHeader.description: A standard HTTP request header that is used to request a specific content type (JSON, CSV, etc) which is "acceptable" to the client and should be returned by the server

searchResultsDbId.name: searchResultsDbId
searchResultsDbId.description: Unique identifier which references the search results

pageSize.name: pageSize
pageSize.description: The size of the pages to be returned. Default is `1000`.

authorizationHeader.name: Authorization
authorizationHeader.description: HTTP HEADER - Token used for Authorization Bearer {token_string}

page.name: page
page.description:
Used to request a specific page of data to be returned.

The page indexing starts at 0 (the first page is 'page'= 0). Default is `0`.

pageToken.name: pageToken
pageToken.description:
**Deprecated in v2.1** Please use `page`. Github issue number #451
Used to request a specific page of data to be returned.
Tokenized pages are for large data sets which can not be efficiently broken into indexed pages. Use the nextPageToken and prevPageToken from a prior response to construct a query and move to the next or previous page respectively.

AuthorizationToken.description: OAuth Bearer Token - A valid Bearer token to prove authorization
